urls.context: Official Website Homepage. Primary entry point for extracting information on investment focus, funds, key people, and portfolio.
Inferred Team/People page of the official website. Crucial for gathering detailed biographies and backgrounds of key professionals (Raja Kumar, A P Vasanthakumar, etc.).
Inferred Portfolio/Investments page. Essential for confirming and detailing portfolio companies (ACKO, FreshToHome, Cult.fit) and recent deals.
Official LinkedIn Company Page. Useful for verifying employee listings, firm structure, leadership (Raja Kumar), and recent activities/updates.
Inferred Funds page. Critical for finding specific details, sizes, and vintage years for Ascent India Funds II, III, IV, and V.
Inferred Contact page. Necessary for finding official contact information for the firm, including phone numbers or specific personnel emails (like Manjunath Kallapur).
PitchBook Investor Profile (derived URL structure). Source of aggregated financial data, fund details, investment focus confirmation, and historical metrics.
VCCircle link covering recent exits (April 2025 and October 2024) from legacy and decade-old portfolio companies.
VCCircle article confirming Ascent Capital onboarded a new LP for its new $240 million fund (October 2024).
Tracxn profile listing the Daya General Hospital $17M Series B investment as Ascent's most recent deal (September 2025).
Business Standard Q&A interview with Raja Kumar, Founder and CEO of Ascent Capital, providing historical context and strategy.
Venture Intelligence interview with Raja Kumar, offering insights into firm management and history.
Financial IT news on the $20 million EnKash funding round, including a statement from Partner Subhasis Majumder.
Article detailing Daya General Hospital securing 150 crore (~$17M) institutional equity from Ascent Capital (Sept 2025 investment deal).
Additional coverage on Daya Group securing PE funding from Ascent Capital for hospital network expansion.
TechCrunch article confirming Ascent Capital was an investor in MyGlamm's $150 million unicorn funding round.
TechCrunch article confirming Ascent Capital's participation in FreshToHome's $121 million funding round.
TechCrunch article confirming Ascent Capital's participation in BigBasket's $150 million funding round.
Economic Times article detailing Ascent Capital leading the $20 million funding round for B2B fintech EnKash (April 2022).
Economic Times article detailing Ascent Capital's 2017 target to raise a $400M fund and summarizing successful exits (KIMS, RBL Bank, Citrus Pay).
